main event: An unidentified object was sighted over Lake Erie on July 29, 1954, by multiple credible witnesses, including police officers and air traffic controllers.
interesting points: The object was described as being in the shape of an inverted bowl, silvery in color, and about 40-50 feet in diameter., It hovered for about 10-15 minutes, then accelerated at 500-700 mph in a northeasterly direction., The object was observed by at least 12 credible witnesses, whose descriptions were consistent., It was tracked by radar at the Cleveland Airport, disappearing from radar at a range of about 65 miles., The investigation revealed no identifiable aircraft in the area at the time.
witness description: police officers and air traffic controllers
